headline: Delta and United Earnings Point to Less Turbulence Ahead
summary: As Q4 earnings season kicks off, Delta and United are showing that often-overlooked airline stocks may be the best value buys in the industrials sector.

headline: United Airlines price target raised to $140 from $138 at TD Cowen
summary: TD Cowen raised the firm’s price target on United Airlines (UAL) to $140 from $138 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The firm says early demand indicators are “very favorable” for United against tough January compares. headline: Earnings live: Intel stock drops, Capital One stock falls on Brex acquisition
summary: A broader set of sectors will be represented when 35 more S&P 500 companies report earnings this week, including Netflix, Procter & Gamble, and Intel.

headline: CEOs Wary of a Jittery US Consumer as Global Tensions Intensify
summary: Delta Air Lines Inc. struck a cautious tone on profits amid geopolitical uncertainty, while United Airlines Holdings Inc. warned that global tensions could weigh on travel demand.  Meanwhile, executives at consumer staples giants Procter & Gamble Co. and McCormick & Co. said shoppers remain cautious.  Signs of strain are lingering in industrial sectors as reports from distributor Fastenal Co. and logistics company JB Hunt Transport Services Inc. disappointed investors.

headline: Gold Has Shone. How Trump, Fed Can Keep It Surging in a Turbulent Market.
summary: Intel is still facing supply constraints, Trump vows retaliation as ‘Sell America’ list grows, airlines brace for chaos ahead of winter storm, and more news to start your day.

headline: Airlines cancel hundreds of flights as massive winter storm sweeps across U.S.
summary: U.S. airlines canceled flights and waived change fees for travelers as a cold snap and massive winter storm were forecast to sweep across the country.

headline: Goldman Sachs Cuts Industry Outlook as Government Shutdown Drags on United Airlines’ (UAL) Q4 Earnings Expectations
